snippet: Jewish and human rights figures warn of historical amnesia as migrants are tricked into going to camps, marked with identification numbers and denounced as dangerous outsiders with a foreign religion.
abstract: Treatment of migrants pouring into Hungary has evoked painful memories of Holocaust years for many Europeans; armed police officers have been spotted writing identification numbers on refugees' arms, and migrants have boarded trains they believed would take them to Austria, only to find themselves headed to reception camps.

byline.contributor: Palko Karasz contributed reporting from Budapest, and Hana de Goeij from Prague.

lead_paragraph: Jewish and human rights figures warn of historical amnesia as migrants are tricked into going to camps, marked with identification numbers and denounced as dangerous outsiders with a foreign religion.

headline.main: Treatment of Migrants Evokes Memories of Europe’s Darkest Hour
headline.print_headline: Treatment of Migrants Evokes Memories of Europe’s Darkest Hour

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
